title: Firefox Doesn't Work...Profile Crash Again
content: Ok so recently I made a post about the issue of Firefox crashing and having to reinstall it, then kind of fixing it by moving my old profile into this one. Thing is, Firefox crashed on me. Again. And now my profile is yet again, deleted. I tried doing the same thing I did but it didn't work. But there's actually two Firefox folders, one that refuses to leave my desktop (I was actually planning on asking for help on this one) and one that I put in the Application Support place. None of it is working though. It could just be because my computer has some issues though, (it's an old one, 2-4 years old and the sides are a bit damaged because somebody forced it into a tiny box and sent it back and I've also dropped it a few times, although I don't think that would impact it, and also Firefox crashes every so often when I open my bookmarks) this isn't the first time Firefox has crashed, only the first time it crashed and erased my profile. If it helps, I was clicking on my add-ons to get a tomato timer to go (after reinstalling it because some of my add-ons didn't work) and then it crashed, with the twirly rainbow circle. I force quit the app and came back. Voila. If anybody has any help, please do. I have work to do and I don't fancy doing it with this hanging over my head.
creator: amylastlast123

title: Clearing the firefox DNS cache isn't working
content:
Clearing the firefox dns cache isn't working. I went to about:networking clicked DNS then clicked the button to clear the cache then restarted firefox and it didn't work.

My http://localhost website is redirecting to https://localhost even though I turned the redirect off in .htaccess.
creator: desbest

title: Firefox Desktop - blurry image under Oculus Link
content:
Hello,

I have Oculus Quest 1 and I am trying to open below VR tour using Oculus Link and latest Firefox Desktop version:

https://show3d.pl/wnetrza/mieszkanie-furtaka1b/?fbclid=IwAR0Y4YKeCSONPCbH522kIUwVEftOzfyn31I0zo2Uce6i5nwCYFtQsamGa5A

Unfortunately, each time when I am clicking on 'Enter VR' button I can see blurry images and broken textures (see the attachments). What is interesting, I have installed also Firefox Reality directly on Oculus and I am experiencing practically the same issue with small difference - before I see these messy interiors an additional notification in terms of... disabling WebXR appears. In both cases I have tried multiple things - changing flags, running desktop Firefox with forced nvidia Control Panel settings (RTX 2060), reinstalling both desktop app and the one in Oculus but with no results... What is even more weird - the presentation above works perfectly fine in Oculus Browser. Do you have any idea what might be the reason of such behaviour? I would be grateful for any clues and possible solutions.

Thank you in advance.

Best regards, Pawe≈Ç
creator: pavl0v
